result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:27 PM Defendant Rene Candelario in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Rene Candelario.  Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court quashes warrant authorized last week and advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Court enters NG plea.  Atty Masana requests TSC be set out re: DPA potential on this case.

Masana has nothing for the record, surprised client isn't here. Moving towards a DPA.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stayed.
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.  Atty Masana requests pre-trial and arraignment.  No objection from State.  Matter reset.  DE confirms address.

Arraignment on August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

9:28 AM Defendant Rene Candelario in court.  Court states case and appearances.  DE applied at PD's office and was denied.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Peter Masana (608) 448-4109.  To reimburse Clerk of Courts Office $50/month beginning on or before 6/1/2022.

02:36 PM Defendant Rene Candelario in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant Rene Candelario in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rene Candelario appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  DE hasn't applied for PD appt yet.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  State makes bail argument - requests signature bond w/conditions.  Atty Getsinger responds.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $1,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with J.U.V. or Bobber's in Lake Delton and absolute sobriety.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.
